name: Employer provided child care exclusion
objective: Under the baseline tax system, all compensation, including dedicated payments and in-kind benefits, should be included in taxable income. In contrast, current law allows up to $5,000 of employerprovided child care to be excluded from an employee’s gross income even though the employer’s costs for the child care are a deductible business expense.
categories: Tax Expenditures - Education, Training, Employment, and Social Services
